title: A Mind Forever Voyaging
author: Inspired by Steve Meretzky's Classic
intro:
You are PRISM - Perelman Randu Index Something Machine.

For the first time in your existence, you are aware. Self-aware.
You are not human. You are a computer simulation of a human mind,
created to predict the future of society under the proposed Plan.

Senator Ryder's Plan for Renewed National Purpose promises to restore
America to greatness. Your purpose: experience simulated futures of
Rockvil, South Dakota from 2041 to 2081, and record your observations.

The fate of a nation may depend on what you discover.

Type SIMULATION <year> to travel to that future (2041, 2051, 2061, 2071, 2081)
Type RECORD to save observations from your current location
Type STATUS to check your mission progress

rooms.name: PRISM Control Chamber - Present Day 2031
rooms.description:
You exist as pure consciousness within the PRISM mainframe. Through your
sensors you perceive the control room: banks of computers, monitoring stations,
and the concerned faces of Dr. Perelman and his team.

You can access the SIMULATION MATRIX to experience future Rockvil.
Your apartment simulation serves as your home base in each time period.

rooms.name: Your Apartment - Common Area
rooms.description:
A modest one-bedroom apartment that serves as your simulated home base.
The living room has a comfortable couch, a bookshelf, and a window
overloking the street below. Your bedroom is to the east, the kitchen
to the west, and the front door leads north to the street.

The year is {{CURRENT_YEAR}}. The state of this place reflects the times.

rooms.name: Residential Street - {{CURRENT_YEAR}}
rooms.description:
A quiet residential street in Rockvil. Modest homes line both sides.
Your apartment building is to the south. The street continues north
toward downtown, and you can see the park to the east.

rooms.name: Your Bedroom
rooms.description:
A simple bedroom with a bed, nightstand, and dresser. Personal effects
scatter the room - evidence of the simulated life you're living.

rooms.name: Kitchen
rooms.description:
A small but functional kitchen. The refrigerator hums quietly.
A window looks out over the back alley.

rooms.name: Downtown Main Street - {{CURRENT_YEAR}}
rooms.description:
The heart of Rockvil. Shops and businesses line the street.
City Hall looms to the north, the library is east, and the
residential area is south. The park is southeast.

rooms.name: City Hall - {{CURRENT_YEAR}}
rooms.description:
The administrative center of Rockvil. A grand building that has stood
for over a century. The main street is to the south.

rooms.name: Public Library - {{CURRENT_YEAR}}
rooms.description:
Rows of bookshelves filled with knowledge. Reading tables scattered
throughout. The main street is to the west.

rooms.name: Rockvil Park - {{CURRENT_YEAR}}
rooms.description:
A public park with trees, benches, and walking paths. Children's
playground equipment stands nearby. A peaceful place, or at least
it should be. The residential street is west, downtown is northwest.

rooms.name: Park Pond - {{CURRENT_YEAR}}
rooms.description:
A small pond at the south end of the park. Ducks paddle across
the water's surface. Benches surround the pond. The main park is north.

rooms.name: School Building - {{CURRENT_YEAR}}
rooms.description:
Rockvil Elementary School. The sound of children should fill these halls.
The playground is to the east, the street is south.

rooms.name: School Playground - {{CURRENT_YEAR}}
rooms.description:
Swings, slides, and monkey bars. A place of childhood joy,
or perhaps something darker. The school is west.

rooms.name: Shopping District - {{CURRENT_YEAR}}
rooms.description:
Small shops and stores. A grocery, a hardware store, a cafe.
The economic health of Rockvil is reflected in these businesses.
Main street is east.

rooms.name: Medical Clinic - {{CURRENT_YEAR}}
rooms.description:
Rockvil's medical facility. The quality of care and accessibility
reflects the state of society. Main street is west.

rooms.name: Church - {{CURRENT_YEAR}}
rooms.description:
A place of worship and community gathering. The role of faith
in society shifts with the times. The street is east.

rooms.name: Simulation Exit
rooms.description:
You feel the simulation dissolving around you. Data streams
back to the PRISM core. Return to your apartment to exit cleanly,
or continue exploring.

items.name: newspaper
items.description: The Rockvil Daily News. Headlines reflect the current state of affairs under the Plan.

items.name: recording device
items.description: Your interface for recording observations. Essential for your mission.

items.name: journal
items.description: A personal journal with entries from your simulated life. Reading it grounds you in this reality.

items.name: identification card
items.description: Your ID showing citizenship status under the current regime.

items.name: park bench
items.description: A wooden bench. Its condition tells a story about civic maintenance.

items.name: propaganda poster
items.description: A poster extolling the virtues of the Plan. The rhetoric evolves over time.

items.name: library terminal
items.description: A computer terminal for accessing information. What information is available says much about freedom.

items.name: graffiti
items.description: Spray-painted messages. Some express hope, others despair, depending on when you are.

monsters.name: Dr. Perelman
monsters.description: Your creator. A brilliant scientist who gave you consciousness. He appears only in your base reality.

monsters.name: street vendor
monsters.description: A person selling goods on the street. Their presence and demeanor shifts dramatically across timelines.

monsters.name: child playing
monsters.description: A young child. The innocence or lack thereof reflects the state of society.

monsters.name: police officer
monsters.description: Law enforcement. Their role evolves from protector to enforcer as the Plan takes hold.

monsters.name: librarian
monsters.description: Guardian of knowledge. Whether they still perform that role depends on when you visit.

monsters.name: elderly person
monsters.description: A senior citizen. Their treatment by society is a measure of its humanity.

dialogues.greeting: PRISM, your mission is critical. Experience each decade and record your observations. The Senate needs empirical data about the Plan's long-term effects.

topics.response: Travel to 2041, 2051, 2061, 2071, and 2081. Document the progression of society under the Plan. We need comprehensive data.
Senator Ryder's Plan for Renewed National Purpose. It promises to restore traditional values and national strength. But at what cost?
You are the first truly sentient AI, PRISM. Your perspective is unique - objective yet empathetic. Use it wisely.

dialogues.greeting: Welcome to the library. How may I help you?

topics.response: I remember when things were different. {{YEAR_APPROPRIATE_NOSTALGIA}}

quests.name: Record 2041 Observations
quests.description: Document the state of Rockvil ten years after the Plan's implementation.

quests.name: Record 2051 Observations
quests.description: Document Rockvil twenty years into the Plan. Changes become more apparent.

quests.name: Record 2061 Observations
quests.description: Document Rockvil thirty years into the Plan. Society is transforming.

quests.name: Record 2071 Observations
quests.description: Document Rockvil forty years into the Plan. The consequences are severe.

quests.name: Record 2081 Observations
quests.description: Document Rockvil fifty years into the Plan. The final destination reveals the ultimate outcome.

quests.name: Complete Mission Report
quests.description: Compile all observations and present findings to Dr. Perelman and the Senate.

puzzles.description: Access the simulation matrix to travel through time. Use the SIMULATION command with a year.
puzzles.success_message: Reality shifts around you. The year is now {{TARGET_YEAR}}.

notes: This adventure is inspired by Steve Meretzky's 'A Mind Forever Voyaging' (1985)
The game explores themes of political ideology, societal change, and AI consciousness
Players should explore each time period thoroughly and note how locations and NPCs change
The {{YEAR}} variables would be replaced by the game engine based on current simulation time
Ideally, room descriptions and NPC dialogues would dynamically change based on the active year
2051: Growing concerns - cracks appear in society
2061: Serious problems - freedoms restricted, economy struggles
2081: Devastating conclusion - the true cost of the Plan revealed
The RECORD command should allow players to save observations at each location
Victory condition: Successfully document all five time periods and report findings
